pullRequest.title: [Microservice] Data-Plane Manager - v1
pullRequest.bodyText:
Data-Plane Manager (DPM) is an important component that connects the resource management microservices and the host agent, and responsible for accepting messages from northbound services, transforming the NB message to protobuf format, and driving down the network configuration southbound down to Alcor Control Agent on the host.
This PR proposes the v1 design and implementation of DPM which includes:

DPM design doc
DPM contract update to be consumed by NB services
DPM REST APIs for port creation, update and delete
DPM service and service implementation for OVS dp
Unit tests to cover a few basic scenarios

nodes.bodyText: throw new UnsupportedOperationException();
throw new UnsupportedOperationException();
throw new UnsupportedOperationException();

A service should be able to handle multiple GS messages.
Why is a GS implementation tied to a GS message here?

Say gss have multiple goal state messages, if we only have one single goalStateService, its setGoalState   method would overwrite its internal goalstate, which could interference with goal state messages, i.e., no parallelism is supported. Is it right?

nodes.bodyText: Use a verb for method name, e.g. serve/send/program.
this.goalStateManager
Please use our alcor logger for any logging need.

@haboy52581 Return a "handmade" results like this basically return 200 SUCCUSS to upstream microservice which is not expected.
Instead, we should look deep into possible exceptions, and use different error codes for different exceptions.
One example is Port Manager which has a full list of home-grown exceptions https://github.com/futurewei-cloud/alcor/tree/master/services/port_manager/src/main/java/com/futurewei/alcor/portmanager/exception
Please check its implementation carefully and see if we can do the same here.

Recommend to use value "$dataplane.isovs"
"$dataplane.gprc.port"
Do we still need all of these values and methods? Those are used in the legacy codes and we should remove them if not needed.
Do we have a scenario to use these subnet APIs?

Didn't see the conversion from List to Array is necessary. If you go through transformNorthToSouth method, the only place to use the array is Line 70 to iterate through the array, which can be done with List as well. @haboy52581
Line 76-78 is same as Line 81-83. Could be consolidated.

This map size will keep increasing meaning that this loop will get slower and slower.
How about thread-safe?

The transformNorthToSouth needs major refactor. The methods has about 300 lines of codes. A general guidance is that a method should be limited to one page long, about up to 30 lines of codes.
If too long, it usually means that we don't break down the logic into small pieces.
port => grpcPort?

nodes.bodyText: If this config is significant, we could make it as a dpm configuration with default value.
Okay. We can leave some comments to remind that they are not in use for now.

I didn't suggest we have to use List. The comment refers to that if we need the conversion or not.
This type of conversion is not free and requires overhead of copying memory from one place to the other. If it is absolutely needed, of course we should keep it as is. Is it the case here?
We might want to do the same change for Output as for input. Not high priority though. This is for our own readability and better maintenance.
